snippet: Magnus Carlsen is on the verge of earning the highest rating of all time, breaking the record set by Garry Kasparov in 1990 and 2000, but ratings inflation casts a shadow on Carlsen’s accomplishment.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column notes that Magnus Carlsen is on the verge of earning the highest rating of all time, breaking the record set by Garry Kasparov in 1990 and 2000, but ratings inflation casts a shadow on Carlsen’s accomplishment.
lead_paragraph: Magnus Carlsen is on the verge of earning the highest rating of all time, breaking the record set by Garry Kasparov in 1990 and 2000, but ratings inflation casts a shadow on Carlsen’s accomplishment.

headline.seo: Chess: Carlsen Close to Kasparov Record
headline.main: Parsing Numbers to Choose Best Ever
headline.print_headline: Parsing Numbers To Choose Best Ever
